poem:
**The Cold Arithmetic**

In the quiet morning chill  
of an English village,  
kettles cough their way to a boil—  
now the weekly reckoning of tea  
against the solemn rise of the meter.  
Old sweaters emerge from trunks,  
memories woven tight,  
while muffled men ponder  
flame and frost,  
the tally of warmth and shadows,  
wandering the pages of yet  
another winter.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Pensioners in England and Wales: how has losing the winter fuel allowance affected you? With the loss of the winter fuel allowance potentially forcing 100,000 pensioners in England and Wales into relative fuel poverty, we would like to find out more about how losing the payment has affected people. What impact has it had on you and what changes have you made to make up for no longer receiving the winter fuel payment? Callout". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
